title: Defines abandonment of an animal and provides for criminal penalties for such abandonment; repealer
summary: Defines abandonment of an animal and provides for criminal penalties for such abandonment; repeals former section dealing with abandonment of an animal.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1878

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 12, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. McENENY, ENGLEBRIGHT -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M.
         of A. V. LOPEZ, MARKEY -- read once and referred to the  Committee  on
         Aging

       AN ACT to amend the agriculture and markets law, in relation to abandon-
         ment of animals and repealing section 355 of such law relating thereto

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 355 of the agriculture and markets law is  REPEALED
    2  and a new section 355 is added to read as follows:
    3    S  355.  ABANDONMENT  OF  ANIMALS.  1.  FOR PURPOSES OF THIS SECTION A
    4  PERSON "ABANDONS"  AN  ANIMAL  WHEN  HE  OR  SHE  DESERTS  OR  GIVES  UP
    5  POSSESSION  OF  AN  ANIMAL  IN A PUBLIC OR PRIVATE PLACE, WITHOUT TRANS-
    6  FERRING OWNERSHIP OR CUSTODY OF SUCH ANIMAL TO ANOTHER  WHO  VOLUNTARILY
    7  ASSUMES  SUCH  OWNERSHIP  OR  CUSTODY,  AND  WITH  THE  INTENTION OF NOT
    8  RECLAIMING THE ANIMAL, OR WHEN HE OR SHE HAS BEEN NOTIFIED OR  OTHERWISE
    9  KNOWS  OF  THE  LOCATION  OF  THE  ANIMAL IN A PUBLIC PLACE AND FAILS TO
   10  RETRIEVE OR TAKE REASONABLE EFFORTS TO RETRIEVE THE ANIMAL.
   11    2. A PERSON WHO OWNS OR HAS POSSESSION OR CUSTODY OF ANY  ANIMAL,  WHO
   12  ABANDONS SUCH ANIMAL, SHALL BE GUILTY OF A CLASS A MISDEMEANOR, PUNISHA-
   13  BLE BY IMPRISONMENT FOR NOT MORE THAN ONE YEAR, OR BY A FINE OF NOT MORE
   14  THAN ONE THOUSAND DOLLARS, OR BOTH.
   15    S  2.  This  act  shall take effect on the sixtieth day after it shall
   16  have become a law.



        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00510-01-1
